question: For the past few days, the tip of my tongue has been feeling dry, as well as my lips.  I live in Hawaii and have been going to the beach a lot but I've been drinking a ton of water too (like a gallon a day).  Then this morning I noticed that my tongue was a little pale, along with my gums.  I'm starting to get concerned.  I have a family history of diabetes and several other health problems.  Could these symptoms be the onset of a more serious problem?
title: My gums are pale and my tongue feels dried out. What should I do?
